item.title: Hazelemere Rd - pedestrianised zone between Priory Park Rd and Glengall Rd (again), 27th August
item.description:
Fridge, suitcase and assorted junk. This is an almost daily occurrence at this now notorious fly-tipping site. Brent council - please restore the bollards to prevent cars/vans driving in to dump, fix the lighting and the overhanging trees, install some CCTV and please make this area a pleasant place to live again

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Artificial light installed preventing sleep, 27th August
item.description:
A flat on Amhurst Park (estimated house number 75-69) has installed a very bright white light that shines out and directly into the back windows of flats on Cranwich Road. The light shines through the bedroom window and prevents sleep, causes headaches.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light on building number 11-20 Courtauld house, 27th August
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned green bin being filled with litter, 27th August
item.description:
There is an abandoned green bin with no lid outside place cottage. It is now being filled with people’s bin bags and litter and is not being taken away by local bin collections. If not dealt with foxes and rodents are likely to start exploring it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Church Avenue, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A large Council bin outside the wall of Place Cottage, 27th August
item.description:
One of the large bins that is used for collection by the bin vans has been left in this position for well over a month now and has not been collected despite weekly collections. They must spot it every week. It’s an eyesore and causes access issues.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Green, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alley between maiden lane and Thames Road, 27th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
